cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles south-southwest of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north along Florida’s west coast, then accelerating northeast across Georgia and the Carolinas and skirting the Mid-Atlantic coast toward New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north Florida Gulf Coast (Big Bend area near Steinhatchee/Cedar Key)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch in effect north of Altamaha Sound, GA, to South Santee River, SC (farther south of the port)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and storm-surge warnings limited to Florida Gulf Coast (well south of the port)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida west coast, Georgia and the Carolinas, then the Mid-Atlantic coast including southeastern Virginia
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Isolated spots could exceed 4 inches, but most areas 1–3 inches
weather_observation.wind: Possible tropical-storm-force gusts 35–45 mph Thursday night into Friday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge 1–2 ft above normal tides possible in lower Chesapeake Bay and adjacent rivers
weather_observation.rainfall: Total 1–3 inches, locally up to 5 inches, risking brief flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands; brief visibility reductions and lightning in squalls
